intro: Tropilis, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the Campanulaceae family. These plants are characterized by their bell-shaped, often yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Tropilis species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in South America. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems.
